00160         bool Initialize(
00161                 const wxFileName &filename, 
00162                 std::size_t node_cache_sz = 500,
00163                 std::size_t string_cache_sz = 10000)
00164                 WARN_IF_UNUSED
00165         {
00166                 assert(!m_initialized);
00167                 m_lastError = ERR_NONE;
00168 
00169                 DiskTreeBackendArgs args(filename, wxT(STRINGTABLE_MAGIC), node_cache_sz, string_cache_sz);
00170 
00171                 if (!m_idx.Initialize(args))
00172                 {
00173                         SET_BAD_ERROR(ERR_INIT_BACKEND);
00174                         return false;
00175                 }
00176 
00177                 // create a traverser instance
00178                 m_traverser = m_idx.GetTraverser();
00179                 
00180                 // create the LRU
00181                 m_cache = new Cache( string_cache_sz );
00182                 if (!m_cache)
00183                 {
00184                         SET_BAD_ERROR(ERR_INIT_CACHE);
00185                         return false;
00186                 }
00187                 
00188                 // create a new file if it doesn't exist, otherwise open existing file
00189                 if (!wxFileExists(filename.GetFullPath()))
00190                         m_file.Open(filename.GetFullPath(), wxT("wb+"));
00191                 else
00192                         m_file.Open(filename.GetFullPath(), wxT("rb+"));
00193                 
00194                 if (!m_file.IsOpened())
00195                 {
00196                         SET_BAD_ERROR(ERR_OPEN_FILE);
00197                         return false;
00198                 }
00199                 
00200                 m_next_new_id = m_file.Length();
00201 
00202                 if (m_next_new_id == 0)
00203                 {
00204                         // new file, write the headers
00205                         if (m_file.Write(STRINGTABLE_MAGIC, sizeof(STRINGTABLE_MAGIC)-1) != sizeof(STRINGTABLE_MAGIC)-1)
00206                         {
00207                                 SET_BAD_ERROR( ERR_WRITE_HEADER );
00208                                 return false;
00209                         }
00210 
00211                         m_file.Flush();
00212                         m_next_new_id = sizeof(STRINGTABLE_MAGIC)-1;
00213                 }
00214                 else
00215                 {
00216                         // ok, ensure that the thing we're loading is what we expect, or
00217                         // if theres a mismatch
00218                         char buffer[sizeof(STRINGTABLE_MAGIC)-1];
00219                         if (m_file.Read(buffer, sizeof(STRINGTABLE_MAGIC)-1) != sizeof(STRINGTABLE_MAGIC)-1 ||
00220                                 strncmp(buffer, STRINGTABLE_MAGIC, sizeof(STRINGTABLE_MAGIC)-1))
00221                         {
00222                                 SET_BAD_ERROR( ERR_READ_HEADER );
00223                                 return false;
00224                         }
00225                 }
00226                 
00227                 
00228                 m_initialized = true;
00229                 return true;
00230         }

00240         bool FindStringId(const char * str, IdType &id) WARN_IF_UNUSED
00241         {
00242                 KeyType key((const unsigned char *)str);
00243                 m_lastError = ERR_NONE;
00244                 
00245                 if (m_traverser->find(key))
00246                 {
00247                         do
00248                         {
00249                                 const char * found = GetStringById(m_traverser->current().value);
00250                                 if (!found) return false;
00251 
00252                                 // did we find it?
00253                                 if (!strcmp(found, str))
00254                                 {
00255                                         id = m_traverser->current().value;
00256                                         return true;
00257                                 }
00258                         
00259                                 // keep on going until we can't
00260                                 if(!m_traverser->next())
00261                                         break;
00262 
00263                         } while (key == m_traverser->current().key);
00264                 }
00265                 
00266                 return false;
00267         }

00280         const char * GetStringById(const IdType &id)
00281         {
00282                 // see if it exists in the LRU cache
00283                 const char * str = m_cache->get(id);
00284 
00285                 m_lastError = ERR_NONE;
00286 
00287                 if (str)
00288                         // ok, return that string
00289                         return str;
00290         
00291                 // otherwise read it from the file
00292                 if (m_dirty)
00293                 {
00294                         m_file.Flush();
00295                         m_dirty = false;
00296                 }
00297 
00298                 if (!m_file.Seek(id))
00299                 {
00300                         SET_BAD_ERROR(ERR_BAD_SEEK);
00301                         return NULL;
00302                 }
00303 
00304                 // read by offset into buffer
00305                 unsigned char buffer[1024];
00306                 
00307                 unsigned bytes_read = m_file.Read(buffer, 1024);
00308                 
00309                 unsigned len = buffer[0];
00310                 unsigned offset = (buffer[0] & 0x80) ? 2 : 1;
00311                 
00312                 if (offset == 2)
00313                         len = ((len << 8) | buffer[1]) & 0x7FFF;
00314                 
00315                 // verify the length
00316                 if (bytes_read < 2 || bytes_read < offset + len)
00317                 {
00318                         SET_BAD_ERROR(ERR_BAD_READ);
00319                         return NULL;
00320                 }
00321 
00322                 // allocate something big enough
00323                 char * s = (char*)malloc(len+1);
00324 
00325                 // copy the string to its new home in the cache if its small enough
00326                 if (len < 1024-3)
00327                 {
00328                         strncpy(s, (char*)buffer+offset, len);
00329                 }
00330                 else
00331                 {
00332                         if (!m_file.Seek(id+offset))
00333                         {
00334                                 SET_BAD_ERROR(ERR_BAD_SEEK);
00335                                 return NULL;
00336                         }
00337 
00338                         if (m_file.Read(s, len) != len)
00339                         {
00340                                 SET_BAD_ERROR(ERR_BAD_READ);
00341                                 return NULL;
00342                         }
00343                 }
00344 
00345                 // null-terminate it
00346                 s[len] = '\0';
00347 
00348                 Cache::Node * node = m_cache->add( id, s );
00349                 if (node)
00350                         delete node;
00351                 
00352                 return s;
00353         }

00366         bool InsertString(const char * str, IdType &id) WARN_IF_UNUSED
00367         {
00369                 if (FindStringId(str, id))
00370                         return true;
00371 
00372                 if (m_lastError != ERR_NONE)
00373                         return false;
00374 
00375                 const std::size_t _len = strlen(str);
00376                 const uint16_t len = _len > 32767 ? 32767 : _len;
00377 
00378                 // get the offset, call that the id
00379                 if (!m_file.Seek(m_next_new_id))
00380                 {
00381                         SET_BAD_ERROR(ERR_BAD_SEEK);
00382                         return false;
00383                 }
00384 
00385                 id = m_next_new_id;
00386 
00387                 // insert it into the index
00388                 if (!m_idx.Insert( KeyType((const unsigned char*)str), id))
00389                         return false;
00390                         
00391                 unsigned char encoded_len[2];
00392                 
00393                 if (len < 128)
00394                 {
00395                         // one byte
00396                         encoded_len[0] = (unsigned char)len;
00397                         
00398                         if (m_file.Write(encoded_len, 1) != 1)
00399                         {
00400                                 SET_BAD_ERROR(ERR_BAD_WRITE);
00401                                 return false;
00402                         }
00403 
00404                         m_next_new_id += (len + 1);
00405                 }
00406                 else
00407                 {
00408                         // two bytes
00409                         encoded_len[1] = (unsigned char)len;
00410                         encoded_len[0] = (unsigned char)(len >> 8) | 0x80;
00411                         
00412                         if (m_file.Write(encoded_len, 2) != 2)
00413                         {
00414                                 SET_BAD_ERROR(ERR_BAD_WRITE);
00415                                 return false;
00416                         }
00417 
00418                         m_next_new_id += (len + 2);
00419                 }
00420                 
00421                 // write the string
00422                 if (m_file.Write( str, len ) != len)
00423                 {
00425                         SET_BAD_ERROR(ERR_BAD_WRITE);
00426                         return false;
00427                 }
00428                 
00429                 // insert into the LRU
00430                 Cache::Node * node = m_cache->add( id, _strdup(str) );
00431                 if (node) delete node;
00432                 
00433                 m_dirty = true;
00434                 
00435 
00436                 return true;
00437         }
